Body:
Description: Hi Support, 

Hope this email finds you well. 

Averis wants to integrate their SMTP server with EPP, in order to receive email Alerts. 
We have tried multiple things, although, we are not able to achieve the goal. 
I request a remote session with you and customer. 
Please confirm your availability for the below time slots, along with your email id, for invite of the meeting. 

1.20 March 2025 (Thursday), 2pm-3pm MYT
2.20 March 2025 (Thursday), 4pm-5pm MYT

Do let me know, which one works best for you and we will send you invite. 

Thanks, 
Milan Singh
Invitation updated. Attendees: No attendees listed
Invitation updated. Attendees: Andre Le Roux
Invitation updated. Attendees: Andre Le Roux, Halodata Support Tech

What We've Learned Updated: The customer is using Symantec Messaging Gateway which is an on-premise email security solution that provides inbound and outbound protection.  The customer wants to set up SMTP on Endpoint Protector using SMG however it is not known what the correct configuration settings are in order to authenticate over SMTP from Endpoint Protector to SMG.

What We've Learned Updated: The customer is using Symantec Messaging Gateway which is an on-premise email security solution that provides inbound and outbound protection.  

The customer wants to set up SMTP on Endpoint Protector using SMG however it is not known what the correct configuration settings (port number, hostname, encryption method) are in order to authenticate over SMTP from Endpoint Protector to SMG.

Next Steps Updated: In our call today we have requested the customer to reach out to the Symantec support team in order to help with the correct configuration settings, we agreed to schedule a follow up remote session with Halodata, Averis, Symentec and Netwrix in order to configure the SMTP service on Endpoint Protector.  Our presence on the call will be required in case we need to access the backend and perform telnet tests from backend to the SMG or SMTP server.

What We've Learned Updated: Sent an e-mail to product security asking to allow the port 25 on our side.
They replied back confirming we can create an ADO to the DevOps.
Next Steps Updated: Will need to create an ADO.

What We've Learned Updated: Sent an e-mail to product security asking to allow the port 25 on our side.
They replied back confirming we can create an ADO to the DevOps.

2025.04.11 - Partner provided an update stating that the customer is now able to receive email alerts.
however there are few email alerts that fail and have requested our assistance in investigating and finding the reason why some alerts fail.

Next Steps Updated: Will need to create an ADO.

2025.04.11 - update was relayed to R&D team, waiting on their response on next steps to take.

Next Steps Updated: Will need to create an ADO.

2025.04.11 - update was relayed to R&D team, waiting on their response on next steps to take.

2025.04.16:
R&D team provided some steps for the customer to follow by clearing the SMTP configuration and setting it up again. I have relayed this feedback to the partner and will update the ticket after receiving their response.

Next Steps Updated: Will need to create an ADO.

2025.04.11 - update was relayed to R&D team, waiting on their response on next steps to take.

2025.04.16:
R&D team provided some steps for the customer to follow by clearing the SMTP configuration and setting it up again. I have relayed this feedback to the partner and will update the ticket after receiving their response.

2025.04.24:
Partner shared our feedback and steps with the customer. Customer has not responded with any concerns of this anymore. Also, most of the questions were already discussed on a remote session with Netwrix support.

For now, customer is good. We can proceed to close this ticket.  Partner will raise another ticket in future, if needed.
